abstract: Clashes between government forces and Houthi militiamen around presidential palace of Yemeni Pres Abdu Rabbu Mansour Hadi in Sana, Yemen, leave at least eight people dead before fighters reach cease-fire; though Hadi's presidency appears to be intact, it is unclear how much of his authority remains, as Houthi militiamen are believed to have taken control of presidential palace and two security agencies.
lead_paragraph: Yemen’s leadership was under serious threat as government troops clashed with the militiamen around the presidential palace and other parts of the capital.

byline.contributor: Shuaib Almosawa reported from Sana, and Kareem Fahim from Baghdad.
byline.original: By SHUAIB ALMOSAWA and KAREEM FAHIM

snippet: Yemen’s leadership was under serious threat as government troops clashed with the militiamen around the presidential palace and other parts of the capital.

keywords.value: Coups D'Etat and Attempted Coups D'Etat
keywords.name: subject

headline.main: Gun Battles in Capital Shake Yemen
headline.print_headline: Gun Battles in Capital Shake Yemen
